description: This course provides a gateway to performance-making through a comparative introduction of the creative roles and decision-making processes of the playwright, the director and the performer. Elements of performance-making, such as characters, character journey, motivation, goals, obstacles, circumstances, etc. will be introduced and applied to guide students to develop a performance-making project. Self-awareness and reflective thinking will be emphasized and cultivated throughout the development of the studentâs project. This acts as an introductory course for other theatre/performance courses in the A&H Major.
title: Thinking about Performance Making
